sourceString: Private vehicle use was banned in the city.
targetString: د شخصي عراده جاتو استفاده هم په ښار کې بنده وه.
en-mt: The use of private vehicles was also banned in the city.

sourceString: Chinese New Year (25 January) celebrations were cancelled in many places.
targetString: په اکثرو ځایونو کې د چین د نوي کال (د جنوري 25) لمانځل لغوه شول.
en-mt: The Chinese New Year (January 25) was cancelled.

sourceString: The authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital, Huoshenshan Hospital, which was completed in 10 days.
targetString: همدارنګه چارواکو د یو مؤقت روغتون د جوړولو اعلان وکړ، هوشین شان روغتون چې په لسو ورځو کې جوړ شو.
en-mt: Authorities also announced the construction of a temporary hospital، Hosin Shan Hospital، which was built in 10 days.

sourceString: Another hospital was built afterwards, Leishenshan Hospital, to handle additional patients.
targetString: وروسته له هغې یو بل روغتون د لی شین شان په نامه جوړ شو تر څو د اضافي مریضانو ساتنه وکړي.
en-mt: Another hospital، li shan shan، was established to protect additional patients.

sourceString: In addition to newly constructed hospitals, China also converted 14 other facilities in Wuhan, such as convention centers and stadiums, into temporary hospitals.On 26 January, the government instituted further measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak, including issuing health declarations for travellers and extending the Spring Festival holiday.
targetString: د نویو روغتونونو جوړولو سربېره، چین په وهان کې 14 نور خدماتي ځایونه په مؤقتو روغتونونو بدل کړل لکه: د انجمنونو مراکز او سټډیومونه. د جنوري په 26، د چین دولت ځينې نور اقدامات هم د کویډ ۱۹ د شیوع د مخنیوي په خاطر تر سره کړل لکه: د مسافرینو لپاره روغتیایي خبرتیاوې او د پسرلي د رخصتۍ غځول.
en-mt: In addition to the construction of new hospitals، China has transformed 14 other service areas in Wuhan into temporary hospitals، such as community centers and studios. On January 26، the Chinese government also took other measures to curb the spread of COVID-19، including health warnings for travelers and extending the spring break.

sourceString: Universities and schools around the country were also closed.
targetString: په ټول هیواد کې پوهنتونونه او ښوونځي هم وتړل شول.
en-mt: Schools and universities were closed all over the country.

sourceString: The regions of Hong Kong and Macau instituted several measures, particularly in regard to schools and universities.
targetString: د هانګ کانګ او مکاو سیمو په مشخص ډول د ښوونځیو او پوهنتونونو اړوند ګڼ اقدامات پلي کړل.
en-mt: Hong Kong and Macau have specifically implemented measures related to schools and universities.

sourceString: Remote working measures were instituted in several Chinese regions.
targetString: د چین په ګڼو سیمو کې د لرې فاصلې له طریقه د کار کولو اقدامات هم پلي شول.
en-mt: Remote measures have also been implemented in many parts of China.

sourceString: Travel restrictions were enacted in and outside of Hubei.
targetString: هوبي سیمي ته په تک را تګ او سفرونو محدودیتونه وضع شوي و.
en-mt: There were restrictions on travel and travel to the area.

sourceString: Public transport was modified, and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.
targetString: عامه ترانسپورت محدود شوی و او په ټول چين کې میوزیمونه مؤقتا تړل شوي وو.
en-mt: Public transport was restricted and museums throughout China were temporarily closed.

sourceString: Control of public movement was applied in many cities, and it has been estimated that about 760 million people (more than half the population) faced some form of outdoor restriction.After the outbreak entered its global phase in March, Chinese authorities took strict measures to prevent the virus from "importing" from other countries.
targetString: په اکثرو ښارونو کې عامه تګ را تګ کنټرول شوی و، او اټکل کېږي چې کابو 760 ملیونه کسان (د ټول نفوس تر نیم زیات) د باندې وتلو د محدودیتونو سره مخ شوي وو. وروسته له دې چې د ویروس شیوع په مارچ کې نړيوالې کچې ته ورسېده، چینایي چاروکاو د دې لپاره چې ویروس له نورو هېوادونو چین ته داخل نه شي، ټینک او جدي اقدامات یې پلي کړل.
en-mt: Public transport was controlled in most cities، and an estimated 760 million people (over half of the total population) were subject to restrictions. After the outbreak reached international level in March، Chinese authorities implemented stringent measures to prevent the virus from entering china from other countries.

sourceString: For example, Beijing has imposed a 14-day mandatory quarantine for all international travellers entering the city.On 23 March, mainland China only one case had transmitted domestically in the five days prior, in this instance via a traveller returning to Guangzhou from Istanbul.
targetString: د بېلګې په ډول، په بیجېنګ د ټولو بین المللي مسافرینو لپاره یو 14 ورزنی احباري قرنطین پلی کړ. د مارچ په 3مه، په ټول چین کې په تېرو پینځو ورځو کې یوازې یو کس انتقال شوی و چې د استانبول څخه ګوانزو ته راګرځېدلی و.
en-mt: For example، a 14-hour quarantine has been implemented in Beijing for all international travelers. On March 3، only one person had been transferred across China in the last five days، returning from Istanbul to Guangzhou.

sourceString: On 24 March 2020, Chinese Premier Li Keqiang reported that the spread of domestically transmitted cases has been basically blocked and the outbreak has been controlled in China.
targetString: د 2020 کال د مارچ په 3مه د چین لومړي وزیر لي کېکیانګ وویل چې د خارجي هېوادونو څخه د چین داخل ته د ویروس د نشر لړۍ درېدلې او د ویروش شیوع په چین کې کنټرول شوې ده.
en-mt: On March 3، 2020، Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said that the spread of the virus from foreign countries to China has stopped and the outbreak of the virus has been controlled in China.

sourceString: The same day travel restrictions were eased in Hubei, apart from Wuhan, two months after the lockdown was imposed.The Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on 26 March 2020 that entry for visa or residence permit holders would be suspended from 28 March onwards, with no specific details on when this policy will end.
targetString: په همدې ورځ بغیر له وهان څخه په ټوله هوبي سیمه کې د سفرونو محدودیتونه وروسته له دوه میاشتو بندیز څخه لغو شول. د 2020 کال د مارچ په 26 د چین د بهرنیو چارو وزیر اعلان وکړ چې د ویزې او اقامې درخواست به د مارچ میاشتې د 28 څخه وځنډېږي خو د دې پالیسۍ د پای په اړه یې مشخص جزئیات شریک نه کړل.
en-mt: On the same day، restrictions on travel across the Hubei region were lifted after a two-month ban. On March 26، 2020، the Chinese Foreign Minister announced that visa applications would be delayed from March 28، but did not share specific details about the end of the policy.

sourceString: Those who wish to enter China will have to apply for visas in Chinese embassies or consulates.
targetString: هغه کسان چې غواړي چین ته داخل شي باید په خپلو هېوادونو کې د سفارتونو او یا کونسلګریو له طریقه ویزې ته درخواست وکړي.
en-mt: Those who want to enter China must apply for a visa through embassies or consulates in their countries.

sourceString: The Chinese government encouraged businesses and factories to re-open on 30 March, and provided monetary stimulus packages for firms.The State Council declared a day of mourning to begin with a national three-minute moment of silence on 10:00 4 April, coinciding with Qingming Festival, although the central government asked families to pay their respects online in observance of physical distancing as to avoid a renewed COVID-19 outbreak.
targetString: د چین دولت، ټول سوداګر او کارخونې تشویق کړې چې د مارچ په 30 خپل کارونه بېرته له سره پیل کړي، او له شرکتونو سره یې د پولي بستو له طریقه مرسته وکړله. د چین دولتي شورا د ملي ماتم لپاره د اپریل میاشتې 4مه نېټه مشخصه کړه چې د ورځې په لسو بجو په دری دقیقې سکوت سره پیل شوه، که څه هم مرکزي دولت له کورنیو څخه وغوښتل چې د کوېد ۱۹ د شیوع په خاطر د فزیکي لرېوالي په پام نیونې سره، خپل احترامات په آنلاین بڼه وړاندې کړي.
en-mt: China's government has encouraged all businesses and businesses to resume operations on March 30، helping companies with monetary packages. China's State Council specified April 4th for the national mourning، which began at 10:00 a.m. with a three-minute silence، although the central government urged families to express their respects online، taking into account the physical distancing caused by the COVID-19 outbreak.

sourceString: COVID-19 was confirmed to have spread to South Korea on 20 January 2020 from China.
targetString: کوویډـ19 د 2020 کال د جنوري په 20مه له چین څخه جنوبي کوریا ته انتقال شوی و.
en-mt: COVID-19 was transmitted from China to South Korea on January 20, 2020.

sourceString: The nation's health agency reported a significant increase in confirmed cases on 20 February, largely attributed to a gathering in Daegu of a new religious movement known as the Shincheonji Church of Jesus.
targetString: د روغتیا ملي ادارې د فیبروري په 20مه د ویروس په ثبت شویو پېښو کې لوړ ډېروالی اعلان کړ، چې ډېری برخه یې په ډیګو کې د شینچیون جي په نامه د عیسی د کلیسا په یو مذهبي خوځښت کې د خلکو د ګڼه ګونې له کبله ثبت شوي وو.
en-mt: On February 20، the National Health Administration announced a high increase in recorded cases of the virus، mostly due to a crowd of people in a religious movement called Shincheon Jay in Diego.

sourceString: Shincheonji devotees visiting Daegu from Wuhan were suspected to be the origin of the outbreak.
targetString: د شینچیون جي مریدان چې له ډیګو څخه وهان ته تللي وو د ویروس د شیوع منبع وګڼل شوي وو.
en-mt: Shincheon G.'s disciples from Diego to Wuhan were considered the source of the outbreak of the virus.

sourceString: As of 22 February, among 9,336 followers of the church, 1,261 or about 13% reported symptoms.South Korea declared the highest level of alert on 23 February 2020.
targetString: د فبروري تر 22 پورې ، د کلیسا د 9،336 پیروانو په منځ کې، 1،261 یا شاوخوا %13 نښې راپور شوي. سویلي کوریا د فبروري په 2020 کې د خبرتیا ترټولو لوړه کچه اعلان کړه.
en-mt: As of February 22، among the church's 9،336 followers، 1،261 or about 13% had been reported symptoms. South Korea announced the highest alert level in February 2020.

sourceString: On 28 February, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in Korea, rising to 3,150 on 29 February.
targetString: د فبروري په 28 ، په کوریا کې د 2،000 څخه ډیر تایید شوې قضیې راپور شوې ، چې د فبروري په 29 کې 3،150 ته رسیدلې.
en-mt: On February 28, more than 2,000 confirmed cases were reported in South Korea, reaching 3,150 on February 29.

sourceString: All South Korean military bases were quarantined after tests confirmed that three soldiers were positive for the virus.
targetString: د سویلي کوریا ټولې نظامي اډې قطع شوې وروسته له هغه چې ازموینو تایید کړه چې درې سرتیري په یاد وایروس اخته و.
en-mt: All South Korean military bases have been cut off after tests confirmed that three soldiers had contracted the virus.

sourceString: Airline schedules were also affected and therefore they were changed.South Korea introduced what was considered the largest and best-organized programme in the world to screen the population for the virus, and isolate any infected people as well as tracing and quarantining those who contacted them.
targetString: د هوایی کرښې مهالوېش هم اغیزمن شوی او له همدې امله دوی بدل شوي. کوریا هغه څه معرفي کړل چې په نړۍ کې ترټولو لوی او ترټولو منظم تنظیم شوی پروګرام وپیژندل شو ترڅو د ویروس نفوس وپیژني ، او په ناروغۍ اخته شوي خلک ګوښه کړي او د هغو کسانو تعقیب او قرنطین کولو سره چې له دوی سره اړیکه ونیوله.
en-mt: The airline schedule has also been affected and therefore they have changed. South Korea introduced what became the largest and most organized program in the world to identify the virus population, and isolate people infected and by tracking and quarining those who came into contact with them.

sourceString: Screening methods included mandatory self-reporting of symptoms by new international arrivals through mobile application, drive-thru testing for the virus with the results available the next day, and increasing testing capability to allow up to 20,000 people to be tested every day.
targetString: د سکرینګ میتودونو کې د ګرځنده غوښتنلیک له لارې د نویو نړیوالو راتلوونکو لخوا د نښو ځان ثبت کول ، په راتلونکې ورځ د پایلو سره د ویروس آزموینې ، او د آزموینې وړتیا لوړه کول شامل دي ترڅو هره ورځ تر 20،000 تنو پورې ازموینې ته اجازه ورکړي.
en-mt: Screening methods include self-registration of symptoms by new international arrivals through a mobile application، virus testing with results on the next day، and increased test eligibility to allow up to 20،000 people to be tested each day.

sourceString: South Korea's programme is considered to be a success in controlling the outbreak despite not quarantining entire cities.The South Korean society was initially polarized on President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.
targetString: د جنوبي کوریا برنامه د ټول ښار قرنطین نه کولو سره سره د وبا په کنټرول کې بریالیتوب ګڼل کیږي. د سویلي کوریا ټولنه په پیل کې د بحران په اړه د ولسمشر مون جای ان په ځواب کې پولنډي وه.
en-mt: South Korea's program is seen as a success in controlling the pandemic despite not quarantined the entire city. South Korean society was initially Polish in response to President Moon Jae-in's response to the crisis.

sourceString: Many Koreans signed petitions either calling for the impeachment of Moon over what they claimed to be government mishandling of the outbreak, or praising his response.
targetString: ډیری کوریایانو غوښتنلیکونه لاسلیک کړل چې یا یې د سپوږمۍ د پلي کیدو غوښتنه کړې هغه څه چې دوی ادعا کوي د دې ناروغۍ مخنیوی د حکومت غلط رسوا کول دي ، یا د هغه ځواب ستاینه کوي.
en-mt: Many Koreans signed petitions that either called for the deployment of the moon what they claim to be the government's mis-shaming of the disease، or praising its response.

sourceString: On 23 March, it was reported that South Korea had the lowest one-day case total in four weeks.
targetString: د مارچ په 23 ، راپور ورکړ شو چې سویلي کوریا په څلورو اونیو کې د ټیټ یوه ورځنۍ قضیه درلوده.
en-mt: On March 23، it was reported that South Korea had a low one-day case in four weeks.

sourceString: On 29 March it was reported that beginning 1 April all new overseas arrivals will be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: د مارچ په 29 راپور ورکړل شوی وو چې د اپریل له 1 نیټې څخه به ټول نوي بهرني اتباع د دوه اونیو لپاره قرنطین شي.
en-mt: On March 29، it was reported that from April 1، all new foreign nationals would be quarantined for two weeks.

sourceString: Per media reports on 1 April, South Korea has received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.
targetString: د رسنیو راپورونو پد اپرېل په 1ۍ ، سویلي کوریا د 121 مختلف هیوادونو څخه د ویروس ازمونې مرستې لپاره غوښتنې ترلاسه کړې.
en-mt: On April 1، South Korea received requests for virus testing assistance from 121 different countries.

sourceString: Iran reported its first confirmed cases of SARS-CoV-2 infections on 19 February in Qom, where, according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Education, two people died later that day.
targetString: ایران د فبرورۍ په 19  په قم کې د SARS-CoV-2 انتانونو لومړنۍ تایید شوې قضیې راپور ورکړ، چېرې چې د روغتیا او طبي معلوماتو وزارت په وینا دوه ورځې وروسته هغه ورځ مړه شوې.
en-mt: Iran reported the first confirmed case of SARS-CoV-2 infections on February 19، where it died two days later، according to the Ministry of Health and Medical Information.

sourceString: Early measures announced by the government included the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events, sporting events, and Friday prayers, and closures of universities, higher education institutions, and schools.
targetString: د حکومت لخوا اعلان شوي لومړني ګامونو کې د کنسرتونو او نورو کلتوري ناستو لغوه کول، سپورتي لوبې، رت پیښې، او د جمعې لمونځونه، او د پوهنتونونو، د لوړو زده کړو موسسو او ښوونځیو تړل شامل دي.
en-mt: Initial steps announced by the government include the cancellation of concerts and other cultural events، sporting games، class events، and Friday prayers، and the closure of universities، higher education institutions and schools.

sourceString: Iran allocated five trillion rials to combat the virus.
targetString: ایران د ویروس سره د مبارزې لپاره پنځه ټریلیون ریاله ځانګړي کړي دي.
en-mt: Iran has allocated five trillion riyals to fight the virus.

sourceString: President Hassan Rouhani said on 26 February 2020 that there were no plans to quarantine areas affected by the outbreak, and only individuals would be quarantined.
targetString: ولسمشر حسن روحاني د 2020 کال د فبروري په 26  وویل چې د وبا له امله اغېزمنې شوې سیمې قرنطین کولو لپاره هیڅ پلان نه لري ، او یوازې افراد به یې قرنطین شي.
en-mt: President Hassan Rouhani said on February 26، 2020 that he had no plans to quarantine areas affected by the pandemic، and that only individuals would be quarantined.

sourceString: Plans to limit travel between cities were announced in March, although heavy traffic between cities ahead of the Persian New Year Nowruz continued.
targetString: د ښارونو ترمینځ د سفر محدودولو پلانونه په مارچ کې اعلان شوي، که څه هم د نوي کال دمخه د ښارونو ترمنځ درنه ترافیک دوام لري.
en-mt: Plans to restrict travel between cities were announced in March، although heavy traffic between the cities continued before the New Year.

sourceString: Shia shrines in Qom remained open to pilgrims until 16 March 2020.Iran became a centre of the spread of the virus after China during February.
targetString: په قم کې شیعه زیارتونه د 2020 کال د مارچ 16 نیټې پورې د زیارتونو لپاره پراته دي.ایران د فبرورۍ په میاشت کې له چین وروسته د ویروس د خپریدو مرکز شو.
en-mt: Shia shrines in Qom are set for pilgrimages until March 16، 2020.Iran became the epicenter of the outbreak of the virus after China in February.

sourceString: Amidst claims of a cover-up of the extent of the outbreak in Iran, more than ten countries had traced their cases back to Iran by 28 February, indicating that the extent of the outbreak may be more severe than the 388 cases reported by the Iranian government by that date.
targetString: په ایران کې د خپریدو د پوښښ ادعاګانو په جریان کې ، د لسو څخه زیاتو هیوادونو خپلې قضیې د فبرورۍ په 28 نیټه ایران ته رسیدلي، په ګوته کوي چې د وبا اندازه ممکن د 388 قضیو څخه خورا جدي وي چې د ایران لخوا راپور شوي تر دې نیټې پورې حکوم.
en-mt: During coverage claims spread in Iran، more than 10 countries reached iran on February 28، indicating that the extent of the pandemic may be more serious than the 388 cases reported by Iran to date.

sourceString: The Iranian Parliament was shut down, with 23 of its 290 members reported to have had tested positive for the virus on 3 March.
targetString: د ایران پارلمان وتړل شو، او د 290 غړو څخه یې 23 د مارچ په 3 نیټه د ویروس مثبت معاینه کړې و.
en-mt: Iran's parliament was shut down، and 23 of its 290 members had tested positive for the virus on March 3.

sourceString: On 12 March, the Human Rights Watch urged the Iranian prison authorities to unconditionally release the human rights defenders detained for peaceful dissent, and to also temporarily release all the eligible prisoners.
targetString: د مارچ په 12مه، د بشري حقونو د څار ادارې د ایران د زندانونو له چارواکو څخه وغوښتل چې په غیر مشروع ډول د سوله ایز مخالفت په تور نیول شوي د بشري حقونو مدافعین خوشې کړي ، او په لنډ وخت کې به ټول مستحق زندانیان هم خوشې کړي.
en-mt: On March 12، Human Rights Watch urged Iranian prison officials to release human rights defenders detained on charges of peaceful dissent illegally، and will temporarily release all eligible prisoners.

sourceString: It stated that there is a greater risk of the virus to spread in closed institutions like detention centres, which also lack adequate medical care.
targetString: دې وویل چې د بند ویروسونو لکه د توقیف مرکزونو کې د ویروس خپریدو لوی خطر شتون لري، کوم چې کافي طبي پاملرنې هم نلري.
en-mt: It said there was a high risk of the spread of the virus in detention centers، which also lacked adequate medical care.

sourceString: On 15 March, the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in a single day, the most recorded in the country since the outbreak began.
targetString: د مارچ په 15مه نېټه، د ایران د حکومت په يوه ورځ د 100 مړینې راپور ورکړی، چې په دغه هېواد کې تر ټولو ثبت د ناروغۍ له پيل راهيسې.
en-mt: On 15 March، the Iranian government reported 100 deaths in one day، the highest recorded in the country since the outbreak began.

sourceString: At least 12 sitting or former Iranian politicians and government officials had died from the disease by 17 March.
targetString: لږترلږه 12 فعال یا پخواني ایراني سیاستوال او حکومتي چارواکي د مارچ په 17مه نیټه له دې ناروغۍ مړه شوي وو.
en-mt: At least 12 activists and former Iranian politicians and government officials died on March 17.

sourceString: By 23 March, Iran was experiencing 50 new cases every hour and one new death every ten minutes due to coronavirus.
targetString: د مارچ په 23مه، ایران په هر ساعت کې 50 نوي قضیې تجربه کړې او د کورونا وایروس له امله په هرو لسو دقیقو کې یو نوی مړینه.
en-mt: On March 23، Iran experienced 50 new cases per hour and a new death every 10 minutes due to coronavirus.

sourceString: According to a WHO official, there may be five times more cases in Iran than what is being reported.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د یوه چارواکي په وینا، ممکن په ایران کې د راپور شويو پېښو په پرتله پنځه چنده ډیرې پیښې شتون ولري.
en-mt: According to a WHO official، there may be five times more cases than those reported in Iran.

sourceString: It is also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran may be affecting the country's financial ability to respond to the viral outbreak.
targetString: دا وړاندیز هم شوی چې په ایران باندې د متحده ایالاتو بندیزونه ممکن د ویروس خپریدو ته د ځواب ویلو لپاره د هیواد مالي وړتیا باندې تاثیر وکړي.
en-mt: It also suggested that U.S. sanctions on Iran could affect the country's financial ability to respond to the spread of the virus.

sourceString: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has demanded economic sanctions to be eased for nations most affected by the pandemic, including Iran.
targetString: د ملګرو ملتونو د بشري حقونو عالي کمیسار غوښتنه کړې چې اقتصادي بندیزونه دې لږ شي چې د ایران په ګډون ټولو هیوادونو لپاره چې د وبا له امله ډیر زیانمن شوي دي ، اقتصادي بندیزونه اسانه شي.
en-mt: The UN High Commissioner for Human Rights has called for economic sanctions to be eased for all countries، including Iran، that have been hit hardest by the pandemic.

sourceString: The outbreak was confirmed to have spread to Italy on 31 January, when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.
targetString: دا ناروغي د جنوري په 31مه، ایټالیا ته رسیدلې وه ، کله چې دوه چینایي سیلانیانو په روم کې د SARS-CoV-2 لپاره مثبت ازموینه وکړه.
en-mt: The disease had reached Italy on January 31، when two Chinese tourists tested positive for SARS-CoV-2 in Rome.

sourceString: Cases began to rise sharply, which prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to and from China and declare a state of emergency.
targetString: قضیې په چټکۍ سره راپورته شوې، چې د ایټالیا حکومت دې ته وهڅاوه چې چین ته ټولې الوتنې وځنډوي او بېړنی حالت اعلان کړي.
en-mt: The case has prompted the Italian government to suspend all flights to China and declare a state of emergency.

sourceString: An unassociated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later detected, starting with 16 confirmed cases in Lombardy on 21 February.On 22 February, the Council of Ministers announced a new decree-law to contain the outbreak, including quarantining more than 50,000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.
targetString: د COVID-19 قضیو یو غیر تنظیم شوي کلستر وروسته وموندل شو، چې د فبرورۍ په 21مه په لامبرډي کې د 16 تائید شویو قضیو سره پیل شو. د فبرورۍ په 22مه، د وزیرانو شورا د دې ناروغۍ د مخنیوي لپاره د یوه نوي فرمان له مخې اعلان  وکړ، پشمول په شمالي ایټالیا کې د 11 بیلابیلو ښاروالیو څخه تر 50،000 ډیر خلک قید کول.
en-mt: A non-regulated cluster of COVID-19 cases was later found، starting on February 21 with 16 confirmed cases in Lambda. On February 22، the Council of Ministers announced a new decree to prevent the disease، including the imprisonment of more than 50،000 people from 11 different municipalities in northern Italy.

sourceString: Prime Minister Giuseppe Conte said, "In the outbreak areas, entry and exit will not be provided.
targetString: لومړي وزیر جوزیپ کونټي وویل، "په وبا ځپلو سیمو کې، ننوتل او وتلو ته به زمینه برابره نه شي.
en-mt: Prime Minister Josep Conte said: "In the pandemic-hit areas، there will be no opportunity to enter and exit.

sourceString: Suspension of work activities and sports events has already been ordered in those areas."On 4 March, the Italian government ordered the full closure of all schools and universities nationwide as Italy reached 100 deaths.
targetString: د کاري فعالیتونو او سپورت پیښو تعلیق د دې سیمو کې دمخه امر شوی. "د مارچ په 4مه، د ایټالیا حکومت په ټول هیواد کې د ټولو ښوونځیو او پوهنتونونو د بشپړ بندولو امر وکړ کله چې په ایټالیا کې د مړو شمیر 100 ته ورسیده.
en-mt: The suspension of work and sporting events has already been ordered in these areas. On 4 March، the Italian government ordered the total closure of all schools and universities across the country when the death toll in Italy reached 100.

sourceString: All major sporting events, including Serie A football matches, were to be held behind closed doors until April, but on 9 March, all sport was suspended completely for at least one month.
targetString: د سیري فوټبال په ګډون ټولې لویې ورزشی سیالۍ، باید د اپریل تر میاشتې پورې د تړلو دروازو ترشا ترسره شي، مګر د مارچ په 9مه، ټول سپورت لږترلږه د یوې میاشتې لپاره وځنډول شو.
en-mt: All major sporting competitions، including Serie A football، had to be played behind closed doors until April، but on March 9، all sports were suspended for at least one month.

sourceString: On 11 March, Prime Minister Conte ordered stoppage of nearly all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies.On 6 March, the Italian College of Anaesthesia, Analgesia, Resuscitation and Intensive Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations regarding triage protocols that might be employed.
targetString: د مارچ په 11مه، لومړي وزیر کانټی د سوپرمارکیټونو او درملتونونو پرته نږدې ټول تجارتي فعالیت ودروي. د مارچ په 6مه، د ایټالیا د انستیزیا کالج، انالجزیا، ریسوسیټیشن او ګړندي پاملرنې (SIAARTI) د ټریج پروتوکولونو په اړه طبي اخلاقي وړاندیزونه خپاره کړل چې ممکن ګومارل شي.
en-mt: On March 11، Prime Minister Kontiti stopped almost all commercial activity except supermarkets and pharmacies. On March 6، the Italian College of Anesthizia، Antalya، Resitation and Rapid Care (SIAARTI) published medical ethics recommendations on the tarij protocols that may be employed.

sourceString: On 19 March, Italy overtook China as the country with the most coronavirus-related deaths in the world after reporting 3,405 fatalities from the pandemic.
targetString: د مارچ په 19مه، ایټالیا چین د نړۍ په کچه ترټولو کورونا ویروس پورې تړلو مړیو سره چین ته مخه کړه وروسته له دې چې د وبا څخه د 3،405 تلفاتو راپور ورکړ.
en-mt: On March 19، Italy turned to China with the world's most coronavirus-related deaths after reporting 3،405 deaths from the pandemic.

sourceString: On 22 March, it was reported that Russia had sent nine military planes with medical equipment to Italy.
targetString: د مارچ په 22مه، راپور ورکړل شو چې روسیې نه پوځي الوتکې د طبي تجهیزاتو سره ایټالیا ته استولې دي.
en-mt: On March 22، it was reported that Russia had not sent military aircraft with medical equipment to Italy.

sourceString: As of 5 April, there were 128,948 confirmed cases, 15,887 deaths, and 21,815 recoveries in Italy, with the majority of those cases occurring in the Lombardy region.
targetString: د اپریل تر 5مې پورې، 128،948 مثبتې پېښې، 15،887 مړینې، او 21،815 رغېدنې ثبت شوې چې د دې قضیو ډیری برخه د لومباردي په سیمه کې ثبت شوې.
en-mt: As of April 5، 128،948 positive cases، 15،887 deaths، and 21،815 confirmed cases were recorded in the Lombardy region.

sourceString: A CNN report indicated that the combination of Italy's large elderly population and inability to test all who have the virus to date may be contributing to the high fatality rate.
targetString: د CNN راپور په ګوته کوي چې د ایټالیا د لوی عمر لرونکي نفوس ترکیب او د ټولو هغو کسانو معاینه کولو کې پاتې راتلل چې تر نن نیټې پورې ویروس لري ممکن د مړینې لوړې کچې کې مرسته وکړي.
en-mt: The CNN report indicates that the combination of Italy's large ageing population and failure to test all those with the virus to date may contribute to higher mortality rates.

sourceString: The United Kingdom's response to the virus first emerged as one of the most relaxed of the affected countries, and until 18 March 2020, the British government did not impose any form of social distancing or mass quarantine measures on its citizens.
targetString: د انګلستان ځواب د ویروس په وړاندې لومړی د اغیزمنو هیوادونو څخه یو له ډیر آرام څخه څرګند شو، او د 2020 مارچ تر 18مې پورې، د برتانیا حکومت په خپلو اتباعو باندې هیڅ ډول ټولنیز واټن یا ډله ایز قرنطین اقدامات ندی پلي کړي.
en-mt: The UK's response to the virus first appeared to be one of the most relaxed among the affected countries, and as of 18 March 2020, the British government has not implemented any social distancing or collective quarantine measures on its citizens.

sourceString: As a result, the government received criticism for the perceived lack of pace and intensity in its response to concerns faced by the public.On 16 March, Prime Minister Boris Johnson made an announcement advising against all non-essential travel and social contact, suggesting people work from home where possible and avoid venues such as pubs, restaurants, and theatres.
targetString: د پایلې په توګه، حکومت د خلکو لخوا مخ کیدو اندیښنو ته په ځواب کې د رفتار او شدت نشتوالي له امله انتقاد ترلاسه کړ. د مارچ په 16مه، لومړي وزیر بوریس جانسن د ټولو غیر ضروري سفر او ټولنیزو اړیکو پروړاندې مشوره ورکړه چې خلکو ته یې وړاندیز کړی و. د امکان په صورت کې د کور څخه کار وکړئ او د ځایونو لکه پبونو، ریسټورانټونو او تیاترونو څخه مخنیوی وکړی.
en-mt: As a result، the government received criticism for its lack of attitude and intensity in response to the concerns faced by the people. On 16 March، Prime Minister Boris Johnson advised against all unnecessary travel and social contact that had been offered to the public. Work from home if possible and avoid places such as pubs، restaurants and theatres.

sourceString: On 20 March, the government announced that all leisure establishments such as pubs and gyms were to close as soon as possible, and promised to pay up to 80% of workers' wages to a limit of £2,500 per month to prevent unemployment in the crisis.On 23 March, the Prime Minister announced tougher social distancing measures, banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activity to that deemed strictly necessary.
targetString: د مارچ په 20مه، حکومت اعلان وکړ چې ټول تفریحی تاسیسات لکه پبونه او جیمونه به ژر تر ژره وتړي ، او ژمنه یې وکړه چې په میاشت کې د 80 to کارګرانو معاشونو ته به په میاشت کې 2500 ډالرو حد تادیه کړي ترڅو بحران کې د بیکارۍ مخه ونیول شي. .د مارچ په 23مه، لومړي وزیر د ټولنیز واټن سخت ګامونه اعلان کړل، له دوه څخه د زیاتو کسانو غونډو باندې بندیز ولګاوه او د سفر او بیروني فعالیتونو محدودیت چې ورته اړین وګنړل شو.
en-mt: On March 20، the government announced that it would close all recreational facilities such as pubs and gyms as soon as possible، pledging to pay a limit of $2،500 per month to workers' salaries to avoid unemployment in the crisis. On March 23، the Prime Minister announced strict social distancing measures، banning gatherings of more than two people and restricting travel and outdoor activities that were considered necessary.

sourceString: Unlike previous measures, these restrictions were enforceable by police through the issuing of fines and the dispersal of gatherings.
targetString: د تیرو اقداماتو پر خلاف، دا محدودیتونه د جریمې ورکولو او د راټولیدو د خپرولو له لارې د پولیسو لخوا د پلي کیدو وړ و.
en-mt: Contrary to previous measures، these restrictions were enforceable by the police through fines and the dissemination of collectibles.

sourceString: Most businesses were ordered to close, with exceptions for businesses deemed "essential", including supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, hardware shops, petrol stations, and garages.
targetString: ډیری سوداګریو ته د وتلو امر شوی و، د "لازمي" ګڼل شويو سوداګریو استثناوې، په شمول سپر مارکيټونه، درملتونونه، بانکونه، د هارډویر دوکانونه، د پټرولو سټیشنونه، او ګراجونه.
en-mt: Many businesses were ordered to leave، with exceptions to businesses considered "essential"، including supermarkets، pharmacies، banks، hardware stores، petrol stations، and garages.

sourceString: On 20 January, the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in the Pacific Northwest state of Washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on 15 January.
targetString: د جنوري په 20، د COVID-19 لومړۍ پیژندل شوې قضیه په واشنګټن کې د پیسیفک شمال لویدیځ ایالت کې په یو سړي کې تایید شوه چې د جنوري په 15 د ووهان څخه راستون شوی و.
en-mt: On January 20، the first known case of COVID-19 was confirmed in washington in a man who had returned from Wuhan on January 15.

sourceString: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on 29 January.
targetString: د سپینې ماڼۍ کوروناویرس ټاسک فورس د جنوري په 29 جوړ شوی و.
en-mt: The White House Coronavirus Task Force was established on January 29.

sourceString: On 31 January, the Trump administration declared a public health emergency, and placed restrictions on entry for travellers from China.
targetString: د جنورۍ په 31مه، د ټرمپ ادارې د عامې روغتیا اضطراري حالت اعلان کړ ، او له چین څخه د مسافرینو لپاره د ننوتلو مخه یې ونیوله.
en-mt: On January 31، the Trump administration declared a public health emergency، preventing entry for travelers from China.

sourceString: On 28 January 2020, the Center for Disease Control—the leading public health institute of the U.S. government—announced they had developed their own testing kit.
targetString: د 2020 کال د جنورۍ په 28مه، د ناروغیو کنټرول مرکز - د متحده ایالاتو د حکومت د عامې روغتیا مخکښ انسټیټیوټ - اعلان وکړ چې دوی خپل د معاینې کټ رامینځته کړی.
en-mt: On January 28، 2020، the Centers for Disease Control - the u.S. government's leading institute of public health - announced that they had created their own screening kit.

sourceString: Despite doing so, the United States had a slow start in testing, which obscured the true extent of the outbreak at the time.
targetString: د یادو کړنو د ترسره کېدو سره سره، متحده ایاالتو په ازموینه کې ورو پیل درلود، کوم چې پدې وخت کې د وبا اصلي واقعیت پټ کړی و.
en-mt: Despite these actions، the United States had a slow start in testing، which at that time hid the real reality of the pandemic.

sourceString: Testing was marred by defective test kits produced by the federal government in February, a lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia, companies and hospitals) until the end of February, and restrictive criteria for people to qualify for a test until early March (a doctor's order was required thereafter).
targetString: ازموینې د فبروري په میاشت کې د فدرالي حکومت لخوا تولید شوي عیب ازمونې کټونو سره مخ شوې، د فبروري تر پای پورې د غیر دولتي ټیسټ کټونو (د اکاډیمیا ، شرکتونو او روغتونونو لخوا) لپاره د فدرالي حکومت تصویب نشتوالی، او د شرایطو وړ خلکو لپاره محدود معیارونه د مارچ تر پیل پورې ازموینه (وروسته د ډاکټر امر اړین و).
en-mt: Tests were subjected to flaw test kits produced by the federal government in February، the lack of federal government approval for non-government test kits (by academia، companies and hospitals) by the end of February، and limited standards for eligible people until early March (later a doctor's order was required).

sourceString: By 27 February, The Washington Post reported fewer than 4,000 tests had been conducted in the United States.
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 27مه، واشنګټن پوسټ راپور ورکړ چې په متحده ایالاتو کې له 4،000 څخه ډیر کم ازموینې ترسره شوي.
en-mt: On February 27، the Washington Post reported that less than 4،000 tests had been conducted in the United States.

sourceString: By 13 March, The Atlantic reported that less than 14,000 tests had been conducted.
targetString: د مارچ په 13مه، اټلانټیک راپور ورکړ چې له 14،000 څخه کم ازمونې ترسره شوې وې.
en-mt: On March 13، the Atlantic reported that less than 14،000 tests had been conducted.

sourceString: On 22 March, the Associated Press reported: "Many people who have symptoms and a doctor's order have waited hours or days for a test."After the first death in the United States was reported in Washington state on 29 February, Governor Jay Inslee declared a state of emergency, an action that was soon followed by other states.
targetString: د مارچ په 22مه، اسوشیټیډ پریس راپور ورکړ: "ډیری خلک چې نښې لري او د ډاکټر حکم لري د ساعت لپاره یا ورځو لپاره د ازموینې لپاره انتظار باسي."وروسته له هغه چې په متحده ایالاتو کې د لومړۍ مړینې راپور د فبرورۍ په 29 په واشنګټن ایالت کې ورکړل شو، والي جې انلی د بیړني حالت اعلان وکړ ، داسې اقدام چې ډیر ژر د نورو ایالتونو لخوا تعقیب شوی.
en-mt: On March 22, the Associated Press reported: "Many people with symptoms and a doctor's order are waiting for an exam for hours or days." After the first death in the U.S. was issued on February 29 in Washington State، Governor Jay Anelli declared a state of emergency، a measure soon followed by other states.

sourceString: Schools in the Seattle area cancelled classes on 3 March, and by mid-March, schools across the country were shutting down.On 6 March 2020, the United States was advised of projections for the impact of the new coronavirus on the country by a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London.
targetString: د سیټل په ساحه کې ښوونځي د مارچ په 3 مه ټولګی لغوه کړ، او د مارچ په نیمایي کې، په ټول هیواد کې ښوونځي وتړل شول. د 2020 مارچ په 6 ، متحده ایالاتو ته په امپیریل کالج لندن کې د اپایډیمولوژیسټانو د یوې ډلې لخوا په هیواد کې د نوي کورونویرس اغیزې لپاره د وړاندوینو وړاندیز شوی و.
en-mt: Schools in the Seattle area canceled classes on March 3، and by mid-March، schools across the country were closed. On March 6، 2020، a group of epidemiologists at Imperial College London was proposed to the United States for the impact of the new coronavirus in the country.

sourceString: On the same day President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act, which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding for federal agencies to respond to the outbreak.
targetString: په همدې ورځ ولسمشر ټرمپ د کوروناویرس چمتووالی او غبرګون ضمیمه اختصاصونو قانون لاسلیک کړ، کوم چې فیدرالي ادارو ته د ودې په وړاندې ځواب ویلو لپاره د 8.3 ملیارد ډالرو بیړنۍ تمویل چمتو کړې.
en-mt: On the same day، President Trump signed the Coronavirus Preparedness and Response Supplemental Appropriations Act، which provided $8.3 billion in emergency funding to federal agencies to respond to growth.

sourceString: Corporations imposed employee travel restrictions, cancelled conferences, and encouraged employees to work from home.
targetString: شرکتونو د کارمندانو د سفر محدودیتونه، کنفرانسونه فسخه کړل، او کارمندان یې وهڅول چې له کوره کار وکړي.
en-mt: The company lifted travel restrictions، canceled conferences، and encouraged employees to work from home.

sourceString: Sports events and seasons were cancelled.On 11 March, Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe, excluding the United Kingdom, for 30 days, effective 13 March.
targetString: سپورتي فعالیتونه او فصلونه فسخه شوي. د مارچ په 11، ټرمپ د ډیرو اروپا لپاره د سفر محدودیتونه انګلستان نه علاوه ، د 30 ورځو لپاره ، د 13 مارچ موثره اعالن کړل.
en-mt: Sports activities and seasons have been cancelled. On March 11، Trump announced travel restrictions for most of Europe، except for the United Kingdom، for 30 days، effective 13 March.

sourceString: The following day, he expanded the restrictions to include the United Kingdom and Ireland.
targetString: بله ورځ، هغه د انګلستان او آیرلینډ شاملولو لپاره محدودیتونه پراخ کړل.
en-mt: The next day, he expanded restrictions to include The United Kingdom and Ireland.

sourceString: On 13 March, he declared a national emergency, which made federal funds available to respond to the crisis.
targetString: د مارچ په 13مه، هغه یو ملي اضطراري حالت اعلان کړ، کوم چې فدرالي مرستې چمتو کړې ترڅو بحران ته ځواب ووایی.
en-mt: On March 13، he declared a national emergency، which provided federal assistance to respond to the crisis.

sourceString: Beginning on 15 March, many businesses closed or reduced hours throughout the U.S. to try to reduce the spread of the virus.
targetString: له دولتي محدودیتونو هاخوا، انفرادي ادارې هم خپلې دروازې بندوي او د وېروس د مخنیوي لپاره خپل پروګرامونه لغوه کوي.
en-mt: Beyond government restrictions، individual agencies are also closing their doors and canceling their programs to prevent the spread of the virus.

sourceString: By 17 March, the epidemic had been confirmed in all 50 states and in the District of Columbia.On 23 March, it was reported that New York City had 10,700 cases of the coronavirus, more than the total number of cases in South Korea.
targetString: د مارچ په 17مه، په ټولو 50 ایالتونو او د کولمبیا په ولسوالۍ کې د وبا ناروغي تایید شوه. د مارچ په 23 ، راپور ورکړ شو چې په نیویارک ښار کې د کورونویرس 10،700 قضیې وې ، چې په سویلي کوریا کې د قضیو شمیر څخه ډیرې دي.
en-mt: On March 17، the pandemic was confirmed in all 50 states and the District of Columbia. On March 23، it was reported that there were 10،700 cases of coronavirus in New York City، more than the number of cases in South Korea.

sourceString: On 25 March, the governor said that social distancing seemed to be working, as estimates of case doubling slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.
targetString: د مارچ په 25مه، والي وویل چې داسې بریښي چې ټولنیز واټنونه کار کوي ، ځکه چې د قضیې دوسیې له 2.0 ورځو څخه تر 4.7 ورځو پورې ورو کیږي.
en-mt: On March 25، the governor said social distancing seemed to be working، as case filings slowed from 2.0 days to 4.7 days.

sourceString: As of 28 March, there were 32,308 confirmed cases in New York City, and 672 people had died from the virus.On 26 March, the United States was reported to have more confirmed coronavirus infection cases than any other country in the world, including China and Italy.As of 8 April, 400,335 cases have been confirmed in the United States, and 12,841 people have died.
targetString: د مارچ په 28مه، په نیویارک ښار کې 32،308 تایید شوې قضیې شتون درلود ، او 672 کسان د ویروس څخه مړه شوي وو. د مارچ په 26 ، متحده ایالاتو د چین په شمول د نړۍ د کوم بل هیواد په پرتله د کورونا ویروس ډیر تصدیق شوې پیښې درلودې. او ایټالیا. د اپریل د 8 نیټې راهیسې ، په متحده ایالاتو کې 400،335 قضیې تایید شوي ، او 12،841 کسان مړه شوي دي.
en-mt: As of March 28، there were 32،308 confirmed cases in New York City، and 672 people had died from the virus. On March 26، the United States had more coronavirus-confirmed cases than any other country in the world، including China. And Italy. Since April 8، 400،335 cases have been confirmed in the United States، and 12،841 people have died.

sourceString: Per media reports on 30 March, U.S. President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until 30 April.
targetString: د میډیا راپورونو پر 30 د مارچ په 30 ، د متحده ایالاتو ولسمشر ټرمپ پریکړه کړې چې د ټولنیز واټن لارښودونه د اپریل تر 30 پورې وغځوي.
en-mt: On March 30، Us President Trump has decided to extend social distancing guidelines until April 30.

sourceString: On the same day, the USNS Comfort, a hospital ship with about 1000 beds, made anchor in New York.
targetString: په ورته ورځ ، د USNS آرامۍ ، د 1000 کټونو سره د روغتون کښتۍ ، په نیویارک کې لنگر جوړ کړ.
en-mt: On the same day, the USNS Tranquility Ship, a hospital ship with 1,000 cutters, made anchor ship in New York.

sourceString: On 3 April, the U.S. had a record 884 deaths due to the coronavirus in a 24-hour period.
targetString: د اپریل په 3مه، متحده ایالاتو د 24 ساعتونو په موده کې د کورونویرس له امله 884 مړینې درلودې.
en-mt: On April 3، the United States had 884 deaths due to coronavirus within 24 hours.

sourceString: In the state of New York the cases have exceeded 100,000 people on 3 April.The White House has been criticized for downplaying the threat and controlling the messaging by directing health officials and scientists to coordinate public statements and publications related to the virus with the office of Vice-President Mike Pence.
targetString: د نیویارک په ایالت کې قضیې د اپریل په 3 د 100،000 خلکو څخه ډیر شوي. د سپینې ما ڼۍ لخوا د ګواښ کمولو او پیغام رسولو کنټرول لپاره د روغتیا چارواکو او ساینس پوهانو ته لارښوونه شوې ترڅو د ویروس اړوند عامه اعالمیې او خپرونې همغږي کړي. د ولسمشر مرستیال مایک پینس.
en-mt: Cases in The State of New York exceeded 100،000 people on April 3. The White House has instructed health officials and scientists to coordinate public releases and outbreaks related to the virus. Vice President Mike Pence.

sourceString: Overall approval of Trump's management of the crisis has been polarized along partisan lines.
targetString: د ټرمپ د کړکیچ مدیریت په عمومي ډول تصویب د اړخونو په اوږدو کې قطبی شوی دی.
en-mt: Trump's overall approval of the crisis management is polarized across the political parties.

sourceString: Some U.S. officials and commentators criticized the U.S. reliance on importation of critical materials, including essential medical supplies, from China.
targetString: د متحده ایالاتو ځینې چارواکو او نظارت کونکو له چین څخه د لازمي طبي توکو په ګډون د انتقادي موادو واردولو باندې د متحده ایالاتو پر اتکا نیوکه وکړه.
en-mt: Some U.S. officials and regulators criticized the U.S. reliance on imports of critical materials from China، including essential medical supplies.

sourceString: An analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict patterns of spread and was published in The Journal of Travel Medicine in mid-January 2020.
targetString: د هوایی سفر نمونو تحلیل د خپریدو نمونې نقشه او وړاندوینې لپاره وکارول شوې او د جنوري په نیمایي کې د سفر طب په ژورنال کې خپره شوه.
en-mt: The analysis of air travel patterns was used to map and predict the spread pattern and was published in the journal Travel Medicine in mid-January.

sourceString: Based on 2018 information from the International Air Transport Association, Bangkok, Hong Kong, Tokyo, and Taipei had the largest volume of travellers from Wuhan.
targetString: د نړیوال هوایی ترانسپورت اتحادیې څخه د 2018 معلوماتو پراساس، بنکاک، هانګ کانګ ، ټوکیو، او تایپي له وانهان څخه د مسافرینو ترټولو لوی مقدار درلود.
en-mt: Based on 2018 data from the International Air Transport Association، Bangkok، Hong Kong، Tokyo، and Taipei had the largest number of passengers from Vancouver.

sourceString: Dubai, Sydney, and Melbourne were also reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Wuhan.
targetString: دوبۍ ، سیډني او میلبورن هم د هغو خلکو لپاره د مشهور ځایونو په توګه راپور شوي چې له وانهان څخه سفر کوي.
en-mt: Dubai، Sydney and Melbourne have also been reported as popular destinations for people travelling from Whannan.

sourceString: Bali was reported as least able among the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparedness, while cities in Australia were considered most able.Australia released its Emergency Response Plan for Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) on 7 February.
targetString: بالي د چمتووالي شرایطو کې د 20 ترټولو مشهور منزل ښارونو کې لږ لږ وړ راپور شوی و. پداسې حال کې چې په آسټرالیا کې ښارونه ترټولو وړ وګنړل شول. آسټرالیا د فبروري په 7 مه د ناول کورونویرس (COVID-19) لپاره د خپل بیړني غبرګون پلان خپور کړ.
en-mt: Bali was reported to be less affordable in the 20 most popular destination cities in terms of preparation. While cities in Australia were the most eligible. Australia released its emergency response plan for the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) on February 7.

sourceString: It stated that much was yet to be discovered about COVID-19, and that Australia would emphasize border control and communication in its response to the pandemic.
targetString: دې ویلي چې د COVID-19 په اړه لاهم کشف شوی نه دی ، او دا چې آسټرالیا به د وبا په وړاندې غبرګون کې د پولې کنټرول او مواصلاتو باندې تاکید وکړي.
en-mt: It said that covid-19 had not yet been detected, and that Australia would focus on border control and communication in response to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 21 March, a human biosecurity emergency was declared in Australia.
targetString: د مارچ په 21مه، په آسټرالیا کې د انساني بایوسیکوریت اضطراري حالت اعلان شو.
en-mt: On March 21, a human biosicorite emergency was declared in Australia.

sourceString: Owing to the effective quarantine of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei, several countries have planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the area, primarily through chartered flights of the home nation, with Chinese authorities providing clearance.
targetString: په ووهان او هوبي کې د عامه ترانسپورت مؤثره قانوني کیدو له امله ، څو هیوادونو پلان درلود چې خپل وګړي او ډیپلوماټیک کارمندان له سیمې څخه وباسي ، په ځانګړي توګه د کور د کرایه الوتنو له لارې ، چینايي چارواکو د دې تصفیه کولو سره.
en-mt: Due to the effective legalization of public transport in Wuhan and Hubei، several countries planned to evacuate their citizens and diplomatic staff from the region، especially through home-based rental flights، with Chinese authorities clearing it.

sourceString: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany, and Thailand were among the first to plan the evacuation of their citizens.
targetString: کاناډا، متحده ایالات، جاپان، هندوستان، سریلانکا، آسټرالیا، فرانسه، ارجنټاین، جرمني او تایلینډ د لومړیو هیوادونو څخه و چې د خپلو اتباعو ایستلو پلان یې درلود.
en-mt: Canada, the United States, Japan, India, Sri Lanka, Australia, France, Argentina, Germany and Thailand were among the first countries to plan to expel their citizens.

sourceString: Pakistan has said that it will not be evacuating any citizens from China.
targetString: پاکستان ویلي دي چې له چین څخه به هیڅ اتباع ونه باسي.
en-mt: Pakistan has said it will not take any citizens from China.

sourceString: On 7 February, Brazil evacuated 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four Poles, a Chinese person, and an Indian citizen.
targetString: د فبروري په 7مه، برازیل د څلور قطبونو سربیره 34 برازیلیان یا د کورنۍ غړي ایستل شوي، یو چینایي کس او یو هندي تبعه.
en-mt: On February 7، Brazil expelled 34 Brazilians or family members in addition to four poles، a Chinese person and an Indian national.

sourceString: The citizens of Poland, China, and India deplaned in Poland, where the Brazilian plane made a stopover before following its route to Brazil.
targetString: د پولینډ، چین او هندوستان اتباع په پولینډ کې ځای په ځای شوي ، چیرې چې برازیلي الوتکې برازیل ته د رسیدو دمخه د تګ مخه ونیوله.
en-mt: Citizens of Poland، China and India were placed in Poland، where the Brazilian plane stopped before reaching Brazil.

sourceString: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were quarantined at a military base near Brasília.
targetString: د برازیل اتباع چې ووهان ته تللي د برازیلیا سره نږدې په نظامي اډه کې ساتل شوي وو.
en-mt: Brazilian citizens who went to Wuhan were held at a military base near Brasilia.

sourceString: On the same day, 215 Canadians (176 from the first plane, and 39 from a second plane chartered by the U.S. government) were evacuated from Wuhan to CFB Trenton to be quarantined for two weeks.
targetString: په ورته ورځ ، 215 کاناډایان (د لومړي الوتکې څخه 176 ، او 39 د دویمې الوتکې څخه چې د متحده ایالاتو حکومت لخوا په کرایه شوي وو) له ووهان څخه CFB ټرینټن ته وړل شوي ترڅو د دوه اونیو لپاره قید پاتې شي.
en-mt: On the same day، 215 Canadians (176 of the first plane، and 39 from the second plane rented by the U.S. government) were taken from Wuhan to CFB Toronto to remain in captivity for two weeks.

sourceString: On 11 February, another plane of 185 Canadians from Wuhan landed at CFB Trenton.
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 11مه، له وانهان څخه د  185 کاناډایانو یوه بله الوتکه د CFB ټرنټن ته راغله.
en-mt: On February 11، another flight of 185 Canadians from Kanan arrived at CFB Trenton.

sourceString: Australian authorities evacuated 277 citizens on 3 and 4 February to the Christmas Island Detention Centre, which had been repurposed as a quarantine facility, where they remained for 14 days.
targetString: د آسټرالیا چارواکو 277 اتباع د فبروري په 3 او 4 د کرسمس ټاپو توقیف ځای ته انتقال کړل ، کوم چې د قرنطین تاسیس په توګه له سره ځای په ځای شوی و ، چیرې چې دوی د 14 ورځو لپاره پاتې وو.
en-mt: Australian authorities transferred 277 citizens to the Christmas Island detention facility on February 3 and 4, which was resettled as a quarantine establishment, where they remained for 14 days.

sourceString: A New Zealand evacuation flight arrived in Auckland on 5 February; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Pacific) were quarantined at a naval base in Whangaparoa, north of Auckland.
targetString: د نیوزیلینډ د وتلو الوتکه د فبروري په 5 په آکلینډ کې ورسیده؛ د دې مسافر (په شمول ځینې د آسټرلیا او بحرالکاہل دي) د آکلینډ په شمال ، وانګاپاروو کې د بحري ځواکونو په اډه کې قرنطین شوي وو.
en-mt: New Zealand's departure plane arrived in Auckland on February 5; its passengers (including some from Australia and the Caribbean) were quarantined at a naval base in North Auckland, Vingraporvo.

sourceString: On 15 February, the United States announced that it would evacuate Americans aboard the cruise ship Diamond Princess.
targetString: د فبروري په 15، متحده ایالاتو اعلان وکړ چې دوی به د کروز کښتۍ هیرمین شهزاده کې سپاره امریکایان وباسي.
en-mt: On February 15، the United States announced that they would withdraw Americans aboard the cruise ship Herman Prince.

sourceString: On 21 February, a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from Diamond Princess landed in Trenton, Ontario.
targetString: د فبروري په 21 ، یوه الوتکه چې د 129 کاناډایی مسافرینو لرونکې وه چې د ڈائمنډ شهزادګۍ څخه ایستل شوې وه په اونټاریو کې په ټرینټن کې راښکته شوله.
en-mt: On February 21، a plane carrying 129 Canadian passengers who had been evacuated from the Diamond Princess landed in Trenton، Ontario.

sourceString: In early March, the Indian government began evacuating its citizens from Iran.On 14 March a South African Airways aircraft chartered by the South African Government repatriated 112 South African citizens.
targetString: د مارچ په پیل کې، د هند حکومت د ایران څخه د اتباعو ایستل پیل کړل. د مارچ په 14 د جنوبي افریقا د هوایی شرکت الوتکې د سویلي افریقا حکومت لخوا په کرایه شوې د 112 جنوبي افریقا اتباع بیرته راستون کړل.
en-mt: In early March, the Indian government began expelling citizens from Iran. On March 14، south African airlines returned 112 South African citizens.

sourceString: Medical screening was performed prior to departure, and four South Africans who were showing signs of coronavirus were left behind to mitigate risk.
targetString: د طبي پلټنې د وتلو دمخه ترسره شوې ، او څلور جنوبي افریقایان چې د کورونویرس نښې ښیې ، د خطر کمولو لپاره پاتې شوي.
en-mt: Medical checks were carried out before the withdrawal، and four South Africans who showed signs of coronavirus، were left to reduce the risk.

sourceString: Only South Africans who tested negative were repatriated.
targetString: یوازې جنوبي افریقایان چې منفي ازمول شوي بیرته راستانه شوي.
en-mt: Only South Africans who have been tested have returned.

sourceString: Test results cleared all the South Africans, including the flight crew, pilots, hotel staff, police and soldiers involved in the humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, all remained under observation and in quarantine for a 14-day period at The Ranch Resort.
targetString: د ازموینې پایلې ټول سویلي افریقیان پاک کړل ، پشمول د الوتکې عمله ، پیلوټان ، د هوټل کارمندان ، پولیس او د بشري ماموریت کې شامل سرتیري چې د احتیاطي اقداماتو په توګه ، ټول د 14 ورځو لپاره په رینچ ریزورټ کې تر نظارت لاندې ساتل کیږي.
en-mt: The test results cleared all South Africans, including aircraft crews, pilots, hotel staff, police and included soldiers on a humanitarian mission who, as a precautionary measure, were all kept under surveillance at the Ranch Resort for 14 days.

sourceString: On 20 March, the United States began to partially withdrawal its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.
targetString: د مارچ په 20مه، متحده ایالاتو د وبا د ناروغۍ له امله له عراق څخه خپل سرتیري په جزوي توګه ایستل پیل کړل.
en-mt: On March 20، the United States began partially withdrawing its troops from Iraq due to the pandemic.

sourceString: On 5 February, the Chinese foreign ministry stated that 21 countries (including Belarus, Pakistan, Trinidad and Tobago, Egypt, and Iran) had sent aid to China.
targetString: د فبروري په 5مه، د چین د بهرنیو چارو وزارت وویل چې 21 هیوادونو (د بیلاروس ، پاکستان ، ټرینیډاډ او ټوباګو ، مصر او ایران په ګډون) چین ته مرستې لیږلي دي.
en-mt: On February 5، the Chinese Foreign Ministry said that 21 countries (including Belarus، Pakistan، Trinidad and Tobago، Egypt and Iran) had sent aid to China.

sourceString: Some Chinese students at American universities joined together to help send aid to virus-stricken parts of China, with a joint group in the greater Chicago area reportedly managing to send 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in the Hubei province on 30 January.The humanitarian aid organization Direct Relief, in coordination with FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks along with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gowns, by emergency airlift to the Wuhan Union Hospital by 30 January.
targetString: په امریکایی پوهنتونونو کې ځینې چینایی زده کونکي د شیکاګو په لویه سیمه کې د چین د ویروس ځپلو سیمو ته د مرستې لیږلو کې د مرستې لپاره سره یوځای شوي ، د راپور له مخې د جنوري په 30مه د هوبي ولایت روغتونونو ته 50،000 N95 ماسک لیږلي. د بشري مرستو سازمان مستقیم امدادي ، د فیډ ایکسکس سره په همغږۍ کې ، د جنوري تر 30 پورې د بېړنۍ الوتنې له لارې د 200،000 مخ ماسکونه د نورو شخصي محافظتي تجهیزاتو سره ، د دستکشې او ګاون په ګډون ، د واهان یونین روغتون ته د بیړنۍ الوتنې له لارې واستول.
en-mt: Some Chinese students at American universities have joined forces to help send aid to virus-stricken areas of China in greater Chicago, reportedly sending 50,000 N95 masks to hospitals in Hubei Province on January 30. The humanitarian organization Direct Relief, in coordination with the FedEx, sent 200,000 face masks through an emergency flight until January 30 with other personal protective equipment, including gloves and gaun, by emergency flight to The Whanhan Union Hospital.

sourceString: On 5 February, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the WHO to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts along with protecting "at-risk populations in Africa and South Asia".
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 5مه، بل او میلندا ګیټس د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان ته د "په افریقا او سویلي آسیا کې د خطر خطر لرونکو وګړو" د ساتنې ترڅنګ د واکسین د تحقیق او درملنې هڅو تمویل لپاره د $ 100 ملیون ډالرو مرسته اعلان کړه.
en-mt: On February 5, Bill and Melinda Gates announced a $100 million donation to the World Health Organization to fund vaccine research and treatment efforts in addition to protecting "endangered populations in Africa and South Asia."

sourceString: Interaksyon reported that the Chinese government donated 200,000 masks to the Philippines on 6 February, after Senator Richard Gordon shipped 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.
targetString: انټرکسیان راپور ورکړ چې د چین حکومت د فبرورۍ په 6مه د فیلیپین سره 200،000 ماسکونه مرسته وکړه، وروسته له هغه چې سناتور ریچارډ ګورډن ووهان ته 3.16 ملیون ماسکونه واستول.
en-mt: Interxian reported that the Chinese government donated 200،000 masks to the Philippines on February 6، after Senator Richard Gordon sent 3.16 million masks to Wuhan.

sourceString: On 19 February, the Singapore Red Cross announced that it would send $2.26 million worth of aid to China.
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 19مه، د سینګاپور سرې میاشتې اعلان وکړ چې چین ته به د 2.26 ملیون ډالرو په ارزښت مرستې لیږي.
en-mt: On February 19، the Singapore Red Crescent announced it would send $2.26 million in aid to China.

sourceString: Japan donated one million face masks to Wuhan, Turkey dispatched medical equipment, Russia sent more than 13 tonnes of medical supplies to Wuhan, Malaysia announced a donation of 18 million medical gloves to China, Germany delivered various medical supplies including 10,000 Hazmat suits, and the United States donated 17.8 tons of medical supplies to China and promised an additional $100 million in financial support to affected countries.After cases in China seemed to stabilize, the country has been sending aid to various nations hit by the pandemic.
targetString: جاپان ووهان ته  یو ملیون ماسکونه ډالۍ کړل، ترکیې طبي وسایل ولېږدول، روسیې ته له  13 ټنو څخه ډیر طبي سامان ولیان ته ولیږل، مالیزیا چین ته د  ملیونه طبي دستانو مرسته اعلان کړه ، جرمني د 10،000 هزامت سوټونو په ګډون بیلابیل طبي سامانونه ورسول ، او متحده ایالاتو چین ته 8 .17 ټنه طبي مرسته وکړه او اغیزمنو هیوادونو ته د ملیونه ډالرو اضافي مالي مرستې ژمنه وکړه. وروسته له هغه چې په چین کې پیښې ثبات بریښي ، دغه هیواد بیلابیلو هیوادونو ته د مرض له امله زیان رسیدونکی مرستې لیږي.
en-mt: Japan donated one million masks to Wuhan، Turkey shipped medical equipment، shipped more than 13 tons of medical supplies to Russia، Malaysia announced millions of medical supplies to China، Germany shipped various medical supplies، including 10،000 suits، and 8.17 tons of medical aid to China and pledged millions of dollars in additional financial aid to affected countries. After the events in China appear to be stabilizing، the country is sending aid to various countries affected by the disease.

sourceString: In March, China, Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy deal with its coronavirus outbreak.
targetString: په مارچ کې ، چین، کیوبا او روسیه طبي اکمالات او کارپوهان لیږلي ترڅو د ایټالیا سره د هغه د کورونا ویروس ناروغي اخته کیدو کې مرسته وکړي.
en-mt: In March، China، Cuba and Russia sent medical supplies and experts to help Italy get infected with the coronavirus.

sourceString: Businessman Jack Ma sent 1.1 million testing kits, 6 million face masks, and 60,000 protective suits to Addis Ababa, Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.
targetString: سوداګر جیک ما د افریقایي اتحادیې لخوا توزیع لپاره ایتوپیا ، اډیس ابابا ته 1.1 ملیون ټیسټ کټونه ، 6 ملیون  ماسکونه، او 60،000 محافظتي طبي چپنې لیږلې دي.
en-mt: The businessman has sent 1.1 million test kits، 6 million masks، and 60،000 protective medical robes to Ethiopia for distribution by the African Union.

sourceString: He later sent 5,000 testing kits, 100,000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.
targetString: له هغه وروسته پاناما ته د ازموینې 5000 کټونه، 100،000 د مخ ماسکونه او 5 وینټیلیټر لیږلي.
en-mt: He then sent 5،000 test kits، 100،000 face masks and 5 ventilators to Panama.

sourceString: Ma also donated medical supplies to Canada.The Netherlands, Spain, Turkey, Georgia, and the Czech Republic expressed their concerns over Chinese-made masks and test kits.
targetString: ما کاناډا ته طبي مرستې هم ورکړې. هالنډ، هسپانیه، ترکیه، جورجیا، او چک جمهوریت د چینایي ماسکونو او ټیسټ کټونو په اړه اندیښنه څرګنده کړه.
en-mt: I also provided medical assistance to Canada. The Netherlands، Spain، Turkey، Georgia، and the Czech Republic expressed concern about Chinese masks and test kits.

sourceString: For instance, Spain withdrew 58,000 Chinese-made coronavirus testing kits with an accuracy rate of just 30%, meanwhile, the Netherlands recalled 600,000 Chinese face masks which were defective.
targetString: د مثال په توګه، هسپانیا د 30،000 چینایي جوړ شوي کورونویرس ټیسټ کټونه بیرته واستول چې دقیقیت یې یوازې 30٪ دی ، په عین وخت کې ، هالینډ 600,000 چینايي مخ ماسکونه بیرته ستنیدل کړل کوم چې عیب و.
en-mt: For example، Spain has returned 30،000 Chinese-made coronavirus test kits whose accuracy is only 30%، at the same time، the Netherlands returned 600،000 Chinese face masks which were flawed.

sourceString: Belgium recalled 100,000 unusable masks, thought to be from China, but were in fact from Colombia.
targetString: بلجیم 100،000 ناقابل کار ماسکونه یاد کړل، فکر یې د چین څخه و ، مګر واقعیا د کولمبیا څخه و.
en-mt: Belgium recalled 100،000 non-working masks، thought to be from China، but actually from Colombia.

sourceString: On the other hand, Chinese aid has been well-received in parts of Latin America and Africa.On 2 April, the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.
targetString: له بلې خوا، د چین مرستې د لاتین امریکا او افریقا په برخو کې ښه ترلاسه شوي. د اپریل په 2مه، نړیوال بانک د مخ پر ودې هیوادونو لپاره د بیړني ملاتړ عملیات پیل کړل.
en-mt: On the other hand، China's aid has been well received in Latin America and Africa. On April 2، the World Bank launched emergency support operations for developing countries.

sourceString: The WHO has commended the efforts of Chinese authorities in managing and containing the epidemic.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د وبا په اداره کولو او ساتلو کې د چینايي چارواکو هڅې وستایلې.
en-mt: The World Health Organization (WHO) has praised The Chinese authorities' efforts in managing and maintaining the pandemic.

sourceString: The WHO noted the contrast between the 2002–2004 SARS outbreak, where Chinese authorities were accused of secrecy that impeded prevention and containment efforts, and the current crisis where the central government "has provided regular updates to avoid panic ahead of Lunar New Year holidays".
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د 2002–2004 SARS خپریدو ترمینځ توپیر په ګوته کړ ، چیرې چې چینايي چارواکي په محرمیت تورن شوي چې د مخنیوي د هڅو مخه نیسي ، او اوسني بحران چیرې چې مرکزي حکومت "د نوي کال رخصتیو دمخه د ویره مخنیوي لپاره منظم تازه معلومات چمتو کړي"
en-mt: THE WHO HIGHLIGHTED THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN THE 2002-2004 SARS OUTBREAK, WHERE CHINESE OFFICIALS HAVE BEEN ACCUSED OF SECRECY THAT HINDERS PREVENTION EFFORTS, AND THE CURRENT CRISIS WHERE THE CENTRAL GOVERNMENT "PROVIDED REGULAR UPDATES TO PREVENT FEAR BEFORE NEW YEAR'S HOLIDAYS."

sourceString: On 23 January, in reaction to the central authorities' decision to implement a transportation ban in Wuhan, WHO representative Gauden Galea remarked that while it was "certainly not a recommendation the WHO has made", it was also "a very important indication of the commitment to contain the epidemic in the place where it is most concentrated" and called it "unprecedented in public health history".On 30 January, following confirmation of human-to-human transmission outside China and the increase in the number of cases in other countries, the WHO declared the outbreak a Public Health Emergency of International Concern (PHEIC), the sixth PHEIC since the measure was first invoked during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.
targetString: د جنورۍ په 23مه، د مرکزي چارواکو پریکړه باندې په ووهان کې د ترانسپورت بندیز پلي کولو په عکس العمل کې، د نړیوال سازمان استازی ګاډین ګالیا څرګنده کړه چې پداسې حال کې چې دا "یقینا د روغتیا د نړیوال سازمان لخوا وړاندیز شوی نه و" ، دا هم "د دې ترټولو مهمه نښه وه. ژمنتیا په هغه ځای کې د ناروغۍ مخه ونیسي چیرې چې دا خورا متمرکز دی او دا یې د "د عامې روغتیا په تاریخ کې بې ساری" بللی.د جنورۍ په 30مه، له چین څخه بهر له انسان نه انسان ته لیږد تصدیق او په نورو هیوادونو کې د قضیو شمیر ډیروالي وروسته، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان راپور ورکړ چې د نړیوال اندیښنې عامه روغتیا اضطراري حالت (PHEIC) و ، دا اقدام شپږم پی ایچ ای ای دی. لومړی د 2009 د سوین فلو ناروغي پرمهال غوښتنه وشوه.
en-mt: On January 23، in reaction to the central authorities' decision to impose a ban on transport in Wuhan، Who representative Gaudian Galia stated that while it was "certainly not recommended by the World Health Organization،" it was also "the most important sign of it." The commitment to prevent the disease in place where it is most concentrated and called it "unprecedented in the history of public health".[30] On January 30، after certification of human-to-human transmission out of China and an increase in the number of cases in other countries، the World Health Organization reported that the Global Public Health Emergency (PHEIC) was the sixth PHEIC measure. AD. It was first requested during the 2009 swine flu pandemic.

sourceString: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom said that the PHEIC was due to "the risk of global spread, especially to low- and middle-income countries without robust health systems.
targetString: د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان عمومي مدیر ټیډروس اډانوم وویل چې PHEIC د نړیوال خپریدو خطر له امله و ، په ځانګړي توګه ټیټ او متوسط عاید لرونکو هیوادونو کې چې قوي صحي سیسټمونه نلري.
en-mt: Who Director-General Tedros Adanoum said PHEIC was due to the risk of global spread، especially in low- and middle-income countries that do not have strong health systems.

sourceString: In response to the implementations of travel restrictions, Tedros stated that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that the "WHO doesn't recommend limiting trade and movement."
targetString: د سفر محدودیتونو پلي کولو په ځواب کې ، ټیډروس وویل چې "د داسې اقداماتو لپاره هیڅ دلیل شتون نلري چې غیر ضروري په نړیوال سفر او تجارت کې مداخله وکړي" او دا چې "د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د سوداګرۍ او خوځښت محدودولو وړاندیز نه کوي."
en-mt: In response to the implementation of travel restrictions، Tedros said that "there is no reason for measures that unnecessarily interfere with international travel and trade" and that "the WHO does not propose restricting trade and mobility."

sourceString: On 5 February, the WHO appealed to the global community for a $675 million contribution to fund strategic preparedness in low-income countries, citing the urgency to support those countries which "do not have the systems in place to detect people who have contracted the virus, even if it were to emerge".
targetString: د فبروري په 5مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان نړیوالې ټولنې څخه د کم عاید لرونکي هیوادونو کې د ستراتیژیک چمتووالي تمویل لپاره د 675 ملیون ډالرو مرستې لپاره غوښتنه وکړه، او د هغه هیوادونو ملاتړ کولو ته بیړني حالت یې په ګوته کړ چې "داسې سیسټمونه نلري چې د خلکو پیژندنه وکړي کوم چې د ویروس باندې اخته شوي. "حتی که دا څرګند هم وی".
en-mt: On February 5، who asked the world community for $675 million to fund strategic readiness in low-income countries، citing a state of emergency to support countries that "do not have systems that identify people who have been infected with the virus." Even if it's obvious."

sourceString: Tedros further made statements declaring that "we are only as strong as our weakest link" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay more later".On 11 February, the WHO in a press conference established COVID-19 as the name of the disease.
targetString: ټیډروس پدې اړه نور بیانونه هم خپاره کړل چې "موږ یوازې زموږ د ضعیف اړیکې په څیر پیاوړي یو" او له نړیوالې ټولنې یې وغوښتل چې "نن ورځ پانګونه وکړي یا ډیر وروسته پیسې ورکړي".د فبرورۍ په 11مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په یوه مطبوعاتي کنفرانس کې COVID-19 د ناروغۍ نوم په توګه تاسیس کړ.
en-mt: Tedros also issued further statements that "we are only as strong as our weak relationship" and urged the international community to "invest today or pay much later".On February 11، who established COVID-19 as the name of the disease at a press conference.

sourceString: On the same day, Tedros stated that UN Secretary-General António Guterres had agreed to provide the "power of the entire UN system in the response".
targetString: په ورته ورځ، ټیډروس وویل چې د ملګرو ملتونو عمومي منشي انتونیو ګوټریس موافقه کړې چې "په ځواب کې د ملګرو ملتونو د ټول سیستم ځواک" چمتو کړي.
en-mt: On the same day, Tedros said un Secretary-General Antonio Guterres had agreed to provide "the power of the entire United Nations system in response."

sourceString: A UN Crisis Management Team was activated as a result, allowing coordination of the entire United Nations response, which the WHO states will allow them to "focus on the health response while the other agencies can bring their expertise to bear on the wider social, economic and developmental implications of the outbreak".
targetString: د ملګرو ملتونو د کړکیچ د مدیریت ډله د پایلې په توګه فعاله شوې، او د ملګرو ملتونو د ټول غبرګون همغږي کولو ته اجازه ورکوي ، کوم چې د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان به دوی ته اجازه ورکړي "روغتیا ځواب باندې متمرکز کړي پداسې حال کې چې نورې ادارې کولی شي خپلې تجربې پراخه ټولنیز ، اقتصادي باندې راوړي. او د خپریدو پرمختیایی اثرونه ".
en-mt: The UN Crisis Management Group has been activated as a result، allowing for the coordination of the entire UN response، which the WHO will allow them to focus on "health response" while other agencies can bring their own experiences to a wider social، economic and economic point. and the effects of diffusion."

sourceString: On 14 February, a WHO-led Joint Mission Team with China was activated to provide international and WHO experts on the ground in China to assist in the domestic management and evaluate "the severity and the transmissibility of the disease" by hosting workshops and meetings with key national-level institutions and to conduct field visits to assess the "impact of response activities at provincial and county levels, including urban and rural settings".On 25 February, the WHO declared that "the world should do more to prepare for a possible coronavirus pandemic," stating that while it was still too early to call it a pandemic, countries should nonetheless be "in a phase of preparedness".
targetString: د فبرورۍ په 14مه، د چین سره د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان په مشرۍ د ګډ ماموریت ټیم فعال شو ترڅو په نړۍ کې د نړیوال او روغتیا نړیوال سازمان متخصصین چمتو کړي ترڅو په کورني مدیریت کې مرسته وکړي او د ورکشاپونو او ناستو کوربه توب سره "د ناروغۍ شدت او لیږد وړتیا" ارزونه وکړي. د ملي کچې مهمې ادارې او د ساحې لیدنې ترسره کول ترڅو "د ولایتي او هیواد په کچه د غبرګون فعالیتونو اغیزو ارزونه وکړي ، پشمول د ښاري او کلیوالي تنظیماتو".د فبرورۍ په 25مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان اعلان وکړ چې "نړۍ باید د احتمالي کورون ویروس ناروغي لپاره چمتووالی لپاره ډیر څه وکړي ،" په ګوته کړه پداسې حال کې چې لاهم لا دمخه د دې ناروغۍ پیژندل ډیر ژر و ، هیوادونه باید "د چمتووالي مرحلې" کې وي.
en-mt: On February 14، a joint mission team led by the World Health Organization with China was activated to provide world and WHO specialists in the world to assist in domestic management and to assess "the severity and transmission of disease" with a host of workshops and meetings. Conducting national-level important administrations and field visits to "assess the impact of response activities across the province and country، including urban and rural settings".[25] On February 25، the World Health Organization announced that "the world must do more to prepare for a potential coronavirus pandemic،" noting that while it was still too early to recognize the disease، countries stated It should be in the "preparation stage."

sourceString: In response to a developing outbreak in Iran, the WHO sent a Joint Mission Team there to assess the situation.On 28 February, WHO officials said that the coronavirus threat assessment at the global level would be raised from "high" to "very high", its highest level of alert and risk assessment.
targetString: په ایران کې د ودې پدیدې په غبرګون کې ، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د وضعیت ارزولو لپاره هلته د ګډ ماموریت ډله ولیږله. د فبرورۍ په 28 ، د د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان چارواکو وویل چې په نړیواله کچه د کورونا ویروس خطر ارزونه به له "لوړې" څخه "خورا لوړه" ته پورته شي ، د خبرتیا او خطر ارزونې ترټولو عالي کچه.
en-mt: In response to the development in Iran، the World Health Organization sent a joint mission team there to assess the situation. On February 28، WHO officials said the coronavirus risk assessment on a global scale would go from "high" to "very high،" the highest level of alertness and risk assessment.

sourceString: Mike Ryan, executive director of the WHO's health emergencies program, warned in a statement that "This is a reality check for every government on the planet: Wake up.
targetString: مایک راین ، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان  اضطراري برنامې اجرایوي رییس ، په یوه بیان کې خبرداری ورکړ چې "دا په سیارټ کې د هر حکومت لپاره د واقعیت چیک دی: راویښ شه.
en-mt: Mike Ryan، executive director of the WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION's Emergency Program، warned in a statement that "this is a reality check for every government on the planet: wake up.

sourceString: This virus may be on its way and you need to be ready," urging that the right response measures could help the world avoid "the worst of it".
targetString: دا ویروس ممکن په خپل لاره وي او تاسو اړتیا لرئ چمتو اوسئ ، "ټینګار یې وکړ چې د سم غبرګون اقدامات ممکن نړۍ سره مرسته وکړي چې د" ترټولو ناوړه "څخه مخنیوی وکړي.
en-mt: The virus may be on its way and you need to be prepared،" he said، stressing that the right response measures may help the world avoid "the worst."

sourceString: Ryan further stated that the current data did not warrant public health officials to declare a global pandemic, saying that such a declaration would mean "we're essentially accepting that every human on the planet will be exposed to that virus."
targetString: رایان زیاته کړه چې اوسني ارقام د عامې روغتیا چارواکو ته ندی رسیدلی چې نړیواله ناروغي اعلان کړي ، او ویې ویل چې د دا ډول اعالمیې معنی دا ده "موږ په اساسي ډول دا منو چې په سیاره کې به هر انسان په ویروس اخته کیږي."
en-mt: The current figures have not reached public health officials to declare a global pandemic، adding that such declarations mean "we fundamentally accept that every human being on the planet will be infected with the virus."

sourceString: On 11 March, the WHO declared the coronavirus outbreak a pandemic.
targetString: د 2020 د مارچ په 11مه، د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان COVID-19 یوه عامه ساري ناروغی اعلان کړه.
en-mt: On March 11، 2020، the World Health Organization declared COVID-19 a common infectious disease.

sourceString: The Director-General said that the WHO was "deeply concerned both by the alarming levels of spread and severity, and by the alarming levels of inaction".The WHO has faced significant criticism for what is seen as inadequate handling of the pandemic, including the late declaration of a public health emergency and the classification of the virus as a pandemic.
targetString: مونږ ډېر زيات د کورونه ناروغي په خطرناکه کچه خپرونې او شدت سره سره دا هغې خلاف ګامونه نه اخيستو په اړه ډېر زيات فکرمند يود روغتیا نړیوال سازمان د هغه څه لپاره د پام وړ نیوکې سره مخ شوی چې د ناروغۍ ناسمه اداره کول یې په ګوته کوي ، پشمول د عامې روغتیا اضطراب ناوخته اعالمیه او د ناروغۍ په توګه د ویروس طبقه بندي.
en-mt: We have been very thoughtful about the dangerous spread and severity of home disease despite the severity of its failure to take action against it، and the World Health Organization has faced significant criticism for what it considers to be an improper management of the disease، including late public health anxiety and the classification of the virus as a disease.

sourceString: The backlash included a petition for the WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom to tender his resignation, signed by 733,000 people as of 6 April.
targetString: په غبرګون کې د روغتیا نړیوال سازمان عمومي مدیر ټیډروس اډانوم ته د هغه استعفا ورکولو لپاره غوښتنلیک شامل و ، چې د اپریل تر 6 پورې د 733،000 خلکو لخوا لاسلیک شو.
en-mt: The response included an application to Tedros Adanoum، who was signed by 733،000 people as of 6 April.

sourceString: On 26 March 2020, dozens of UN human rights experts emphasized respecting the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.
targetString: د 2020 کال د مارچ په 26مه، د ملګرو ملتونو د بشري حقونو لسګونو متخصصینو د COVID-19 وبا پرمهال د هر فرد د حقونو درناوی ټینګار وکړ.
en-mt: On 26 March 2020، dozens of UN human rights experts stressed the respect for the rights of every individual during the COVID-19 pandemic.

sourceString: The expert group stated that everyone is entitled to life-saving interventions and the government holds this responsibility.
targetString: ماهر ډلې څرګنده کړه چې هرڅوک د ژوند ژغورنې مداخلو مستحق دي او حکومت دا مسؤلیت په غاړه لري.
en-mt: The expert group stated that everyone deserves life-saving interventions and the government is responsible for this.
